titles.title: Lumbee Recognition Act
To provide for the recognition of the Lumbee Tribe of Cheraw Indians of North Carolina, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Native American Affairs.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 27 - 14.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-290.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 159.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 286 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 334 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 2(l)(2)(B) of rule XI are waived. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 286.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 334 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 2(l)(2)(B) of rule XI are waived. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 286 and Rule XXIII.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Douglas "Pete" Peterson to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 334.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 228 - 184 (Roll no. 538).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 333.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Lumbee Recognition Act - Extends Federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of Cheraw Indians of North Carolina.
